definition: gun barrel
gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots
surname Qiang
stick/pole/lever/classifier for long objects such as guns
gun barrel
gun barrel

sentences.english: He understands that the days are gone when the party can maintain political stability with the muzzle of a gun.
sentences.chinese: 他知道一個政黨靠槍桿子出政權的日子一去不復返了。

sentences.english: Words may well be a powerful weapon, as powerful as a gun.
sentences.chinese: 文字可以是強大的武器，和槍桿子一樣硬。

sentences.english: By rule of gun wonders can be achieved anywhere even in India.
sentences.chinese: 槍桿子裏出政權，哪裏都一樣，包括印度。

sentences.english: Land disputes became overheated and were frequently resolved at the point of a gun.
sentences.chinese: 土地爭端變得火爆異常，而且基本上是槍桿子說了算。

sentences.english: Selected Works of Mao Tse-tung is the classic translation penned by those translators but who were being guarded by gun.
sentences.chinese: 是手裏拿着筆桿子背後站着槍桿子逼出來的經典翻譯。

sentences.english: Bullets change governments far surer than votes.
sentences.chinese: 改朝換代槍桿子可比選票可靠得多。

sentences.english: His spear shaft was like a weaver's rod, and its iron point weighed six hundred shekels.
sentences.chinese: 槍桿粗如織布的機軸，鐵槍頭重六百舍客勒。

sentences.english: The political power come form guns.
The municipal guard burst into a laugh and raised his bayonet at the child.
sentences.chinese: 那個保安警察放聲大笑，提起槍桿向孩子刺去。

sentences.english: Prachanda: To take up weapons is just a form of politics.
sentences.chinese: 拿起槍桿子只是一種政治方式。

sentences.english: Everything in Yenan has been created by having guns.
sentences.chinese: 延安的一切就是槍桿子造出來的。

sentences.english: Although the Egyptian had a spear like a weaver's rod in his hand, Benaiah went against him with a club.
sentences.chinese: 埃及人身高五肘，手裏拿着槍，槍桿粗如織布的機軸。

definition: lit. view a text and interpret (idiom); to interpret word by word without understanding the meaning/a far-fetched interpretation
toadying for personal gain/to curry favor/to study in great depth
to appoint people by favoritism (idiom); nepotism/corrupt appointment
delaying tactics/stalling/measures to stave off an attack/stratagem to win a respite
crafty plots and machinations (idiom)
hunger strike
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: diligent and thrifty (idiom)
to use public office to avenge private wrongs
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
victory is in sight
sectarian bias/parochialism
to walk right into the trap
(political) party platform/party program
lit. no one picks up lost articles in the street (idiom)/fig. honesty prevails throughout society
principle of people's livelihood, the third of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning redistribution of wealth, self-sufficiency and internal trade)
